709652f-a.text:
46-62 Seventh Ave., west side, north from, but not including West 13tu.., to ard including West 14th Streets. Building shown (No. 48-58) in the state
of collapse, was the Metropolitan Temple, (M.E.).

Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.

709653f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue, vest side, from 13th to 14th Streets.
November 2, 1930.

730224f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 13th Street - 7th Avenue (West).]
730224f-a.text:
W. 13th Street, north side, west of Seventh Avenue,
(general view northward).
A photograph taken from a dwelling structure at the above location viewing up Seventh Avenue (at the right) and across W. 14th Street, to show tall structures built in the last several years, on and around Seventh Avenue. From left to right these are, the 19 story New York Telephone Co., Building (No. 206 W. 18th Street), the 18 story apartment house No. 90 Seventh Avenue (at the S. W. corner of W. l6th Street), the 18 story apartment house, No. 72 Seventh Avenue (S. W. corner of W. 15th Street) and the 18 story apartment house, No. 101 Seventh Avenue (N . E. corner of W. l6th Street) Across the latter appears the unfinshed tower of the Empire State Building To the left is the roof of the 7 story structure occupied by the publishing firm of Street and Smith (No. 79-89 Seventh Avenue).
February 6, 1931
P. L. Sperr

709662f-a.text: Seventh Avenue at N.E. corner of 13th Street. P.L. Sperr,Photographer.  May 27, 1931.

709660f-a.text:
Metropolitan Temple (Methodist Episcopal) at N. W. corner of  Seventh Avenue and 13th Street.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.  December 22, 1932.

  
  
.

711177f-b.text:
(1)
13th Street, west from and including Seventh Avenue, showing the clearing on the N.W corner where the new Metropolitan Temple of Seventh Avenue for the house which used to stand on this corner. May 28, 1931

(2)
A view mainly of the South side. Also shown are Nos. 40, 38, and 36 Seventh Ave., at, adjoining and south of the S.W corner of 13th. The building bearing flag (208-218 West 13th Street, is P.S No. 16). July 10, 1936.

709659f-b.text:
Seventh Avenue, at 8W. 13th Street (center) as viewed north eastward from the vacnnt lot on the NeSt side of the Avenue between 12th and 13th Streets. Sere stood the old row of buildings that were familiarly known as the "Rhinelander Flats" and which were recently demolished after several postponements. Note the P.A.L. (Police ithletic League) shack with checker olayers surrounding same which is staffed by W. P. A. employees. Ldildings seen are on the east side of this thorouughfare; View No. 2 emphasizing the 13th to 14th Street block. To the left of this is thhe Netropolitan Tempple at the N.W. correr nf tPe Avenue and 13th Street. Oposite this and the S.W. corner of 14th Street is a large loft and office structure.
June 15, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
